ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Direct experience consulting for a client.
Getting hands-on experience was very interesting.
Client projects are the focus and key to the course. Wait to take this course until there is a project that fits your interests.
The actual clinic assignments themselves. The one-on-ones with Maureen were helpful, but the actual class time was less so.
Having the professor guide us through the consulting process with our clients was very helpful
The feedback from coaching. Now I realize how all of it was spot on and the instructors really know what they are talking about.
good client interaction good feedback on deliverables
The client interaction was great. The class offers the opportunity to get your work in front of and used by real leading companies.
The guest speakers, sessions with the professor when working on your own project/client, the work with the client.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: There isn't much specific help that can be offered. The project vary drastically so getting help from the professor can be difficult (which is very understandable).
The lectures were often quite dull and lacked really deep content. That being said, the bulk of the learning in this course happens outside the classroom.
The lecture/guest speakers were just ok-- mostly didn't apply to my interests.
I'd maybe change the format of the teammate evaluations to give a bit more room for explanation instead of just a rating scale and a list of 3 things to improve on and strong assets.
Feedback for deliverables could be more organized, perhaps in comments margin instead of written in text.

Pointers about how to work in teams would have been helpful. There was one lecture on this in the beginning, but more sessions throughout the class on topics such as team communication and how best to contribute would have been more useful.
I think we can learn more from each other's / other group's work. Maybe more discussion related to our projects (that now only happened after the presentations).

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Some of the guest lectures were repetitive. It was good to hear from each of the clients, but more skills-based lectures would have been more useful.

Yes, absolutely, during the discussions with the professor we could dive into our real work with the client which was great. However, it would have been helpful to have discussion sections with the entire class so that we could have helped and learned from each other.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Provides great consulting and real-world experience that is helpful to have and more diverse than just academics.
This is a practicum to apply what I have learned about business strategies in other FES classes. I'm interested in how businesses can contribute to climate change solutions.

I focus partially on corporate sustainability and this gave me the exposure to a real business and its challenges by working with a real client, and it provided a lot of helpful concepts/insights through the (guest) lectures.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Because a relevant project happened to come up.
Maureen is an amazing professor and the client projects are almost always top notch. This course is a great opportunity to get real-world experience with high-level clients.
The client was a perfect fit to my interests. Networking, as well as exposure.
For the practical experience and to build my consulting skills and experience. The bonus was getting team experience.
Because of my interest in corporate sustainability and because the team I worked with was looking for another member and it interested me a lot.
To fulfill my academic credit

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Yes, you get out of the projects what you put in.
Yes. Great.
Yes, I am glad I took this course

Yes! So helpful! It might have been to elementary for those already in entrepreneurship, but the pace was right for a beginner. Although, many SOM students didn't seem to know a lot either. So maybe that's not true.
Yes
Yes
Yes, I think so.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We were able to complete a huge project that otherwise would have taken a single person many months to complete.
All busy schedules, different priorities. Some people were more engaged and prioritized the assignment more than the others. But it was great to build relationships with others in FES.
It was difficult to schedule meetings and dividing up the workload in a fair manner.
Great advantage, you learn to work as a team and it is much nicer to work as a team for a client because you can be way more effective as well as complement each other.
I enjoyed working in a group because it is a way to learn how the real world works. It teaches you how to work with people, what to say when there is disagreement...

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: As said before, take this when there is a project/client that meets your interests. the projects vary from year to year so don't just join the class and take a project that isn't interesting to you, because you will spend many hours working on it, and there's likely to be a more fitting project if you wait.
Take it- just make sure you pick the right client that fits with your interests.

Begin delegating tasks in the group right away, but also work on some issues together as a group. Learning how to effectively share and generate ideas together are useful skills. Some parts of your final product should really represent a team effort.
Definitely take it if you want some hands on experience with business! Make sure you pick the right project because that is your key focus for this course during the entire semester.
